title: Issue fixed
text: So as none of you will know I had an issue where threads would crash upon replying to a post or creating a post, well the issue was fixed, but to be honest I don't feel like it deserves 5 stars, that's because it's still an app in development and could use some upgrades, like DM's, translating posts and replies, being able to lookup gifs within the app and the list could go on and on, but overall it's a pretty good start

title: Easy to create a troll-free social media experience
text: Positivity, intelligent thought, friendly people and stimulating conversation are all I have on my Threads timeline. It‚Äôs easy to curate who you want to follow and be followed by to create a troll-free social media experience. Negativity, prejudice and personal attacks don‚Äôt happen with a tap of the block button when vetting who to follow. Takes a minute but worth it to tailor make a positive experience.

title: Could be better
text: I like the attempt, the layout is nice and a few other things but the algorithm, no hashtags, and the fact that you need instagram to DM and do other things. The algorithm shows stuff that is triggering to me and also that im just not interested in like politics and hate speech. No matter how much I interact with stuff I actually like I see the same old stuff over and over again of people fighting or bragging that they have 10k followers. I feel just adding text posts without pictures like threads is now to instagram would have been better

title: Mediocre
text:
The app has serious audio and video glitches. Sometimes the first video you see will keep playing audio even when you close the app. The feed makes no sense at all. I constantly see content from people I don‚Äôt follow or know or care about. There‚Äôs no search functionality. Way too much unsolicited messages etc‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs one of the more frustrating apps I‚Äôve used.

Update:  This app seems to be full of viruses.  There are numerous issues related to persistent audio even after force quitting the app.  The Apple customer service rep told me they wouldn‚Äôt install on their phone and recommended deleting

title: What it needs!
text:
#1 This app needs an easier way to transfer the same people you follow on Instagram to the app after  your profile is already created 
#2 there should be a way to accept all the follow requests and follow back anyone who followed you who you follow back on Instagram 
#3 on the notifications tab make a tab for only new follows !

Those are the 3 things I‚Äôve noticed within 5 minutes of downloading that this app needs

title: Still No App for the IPad
text: It‚Äôs been years now and still no app formatted for the IPad, neither Instagram or now Threads. This is a sign that social media is not to feared. How will social media take over the world if they can‚Äôt even design an app for big screen mobile users. I still have to suffer looking at Instagram with a screen smaller than my cell phone display. It‚Äôs not like Meta can‚Äôt afford to pay some brainiac for what could be a half an hours time to make the screen bigger. They‚Äôre making loads of cash.

title: It actually works!
text: It‚Äôs weird to have a text focused social media app work correctly. Everyone‚Äôs gotten so used to the bird app crashing and functions not functioning daily, that it‚Äôs a breath of fresh air to have Threads actually work as intended. There are a few things that need to be sorted out (I want my feed to be more focused on people I actually follow), but for only being a week old, it‚Äôs pretty great.

title: Overwhelming
text: I just want to see what I WANT to see in my feed. What I‚Äôm interested in. I‚Äôm literally seeing a million things I don‚Äôt want to see with notifications flashing that my feed is updating with even more things I don‚Äôt care about. Suddenly I don‚Äôt care about the app and I‚Äôve only had it for 10 minutes. Stop pushing topics and other users on me. I‚Äôm capable of finding my interests. Build on them slowly by suggesting related accounts overtime, sure. Stop bombarding me with irrelevance. It‚Äôs like driving on a road with so many billboards you can even see where you‚Äôre driving lol. Makes me want to stop and just turn around.

title: Stop putting random verified accounts in my feed
text: Threads has potential to be a really fun app, it was great for the first few minutes before i refreshed the page. Right when you refresh the feed you get bombarded with posts from a bunch of random verified accounts you don‚Äôt follow and you‚Äôre lucky if you see something from someone you actually follow. If this issue doesn‚Äôt get sorted out soon I‚Äôll be on my way out. If threads wants to be a real competitor to twitter they need to fix the feed.

title: It‚Äôs a good start but a few features would make it better
text: It‚Äôs pretty good overall, love the simplicity.  I enjoy that there are no reels or stories.  I do wish that my ‚Äúfeed‚Äù didn‚Äôt have random people I don‚Äôt know.  I want to see activity of only those I follow.  There should be a separate page of ‚Äúrecommended people‚Äù to follow.  The other thing would be to make it easy to switch accounts if you have multiple accounts, like a personal and business account.  Lastly, add Business Suite integration.

title: Thank you to Instagram, Specifically Amy.
text: Empathy is all said and done with actions; not words we take away from hypocrisy or movements in the moments. Art forms/files 4 life; We all ain‚Äôt different if we not a humanitarian enough to seek out flaws in society‚Äôs social standpoints of topics BASED soulmates in Heresay every day we live the life we want with empathy and forgiveness at our sides to battle an amazing worldly war internally (or even internationally with friends. #54 üçÄ

title: It‚Äôs a start
text:
It‚Äôs a great start, but so much more needs to be done. It does not have to be a clone to that other site, but there needs to be a way to privately chat with other users. That shouldn‚Äôt be too difficult since it is a feature on Instagram.

Additionally, a desktop version would be wonderful for those of us who are visually impaired and can‚Äôt stare at a phone all day. yes, I am speaking about myself, but I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôm not alone. I would use this app much more if it was available on my laptop.

title: App is the worst they need a lot of fixing
text: Alright so I wanna start by saying one the app got a limit of likes that you can give idk if it‚Äôs in a day or a month but for any little thing they block your account and not only threads but Instagram and then you have to recover your password well reset it so far I have reset my password and got blocked more than 7 times ü§¶üèæ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

title: WARNING: DO NOT DOWNLOAD THIS!!!
text: I was happy enjoying, personalizing, and customizing my instagram as I wish until I downloaded threads and linked the account to my instagram. Now, this terrible app is displaying a promotion on my instagram page to infect more happy instagram users into downloading the app. I can not remove the threads advertisement from my instagram page, and I can not delete my threads account without deleting my instagram account. Even if I deactivate my threads account, there is a broken link displayed on my instagram page trap clickbait to infect your instagram account with this same problem. Shame on you facebook. smh

title: Needs One Thing!
text: This is almost a perfect replacement for Twitter minus one thing. This app needs a way to tell the algorithm to show fewer recommendations like these. Right now I have no way to train the algorithm to show me posts that would keep me scrolling. It either needs the option to show more or show less similar content like we have on the Google app‚Äôs homepage or we need a way to limit what we see to the accounts we have followed. Once that is added, this looks to be a five star worthy app!

title: Great platform. Terrible Privacy Settings
text:
Platform runs well. The first day of launch the algorithm focused on only the newest Threads being shared first, then it started older threads on day 2 which killed the vibe. 

Beyond that the app requires way to much invasion of personal privacy and information that Meta takes and sells to companies to use to target their consumers. Literally all of the data collected on you personal devices which also includes browsing history, apps used, time spent on those apps, ethnicity, religion, political party, and so much more. 

There needs to be a limit to how much data these companies can collect.

title: Threads needs a way to group the people I follow
text:
The app works great and looks good.

However,

I like to group accounts I follow so I can see only a few of them at a time.

For example:  if I was following a slew of newspapers and other media, I might have a group called ‚Äúmedia.‚Äù  If I wanted to check up in what was happening in science lately, I would have a list named ‚Äúscience‚Äù which contained the accounts which posted mostly scientific discoveries and research.

I cannot stress how useful this grouping, filing or classification tool would be.  Without it, the information I receive is just jumbled and without order. 

To be truly useful, information received must be ordered and stored and if Threads strives for true utility the ability to function as an encyclopedia is truly necessary.

title: X formerly known as Twitter is just better
text: First and foremost I‚Äôm tired of instagram popping in threads from people I don‚Äôt know or follow onto my feed. I realize Facebook aka ‚ÄúMeta‚Äù owns all of them and want to keep traffic to their new precious snowflake app but it‚Äôs really annoying that there isn‚Äôt a way to remove threads from IG so far as I can tell. X has a better setup, they clearly have a better algorithm because the recommended pages are related to the stuff that I already follow whereas Threads just seems to push all of the popular political posts or posts pertaining to Elon Musk which is hilarious bc that maniac is living in your heads rent free.

title: Irrelevant feed üôÑ
text:
So disappointed but not surprised. Spent my first 2 weeks on Threads muting irrelevant influencers, celebrities, and companies. I just want to see authentic content from the people I actually follow. Not random ‚Äúverified‚Äù accounts. Threads had so much potential to be better than Twitter but Meta is too busy manipulating the algorithm as usual. Just deleted the Threads app from my phone, so tired of wasting time on these apps anyways.
Update: after a month, redownloaded Threads to see if it got any better. None of my friends/followers are active, so basically there‚Äôs nobody except social media managers of verified accounts to engage with.üòíüëéüèº

title: Beware of privacy concerns and can‚Äôt be deleted.
text: Beware you can‚Äôt delete this app once it‚Äôs downloaded, it will only let you deactivate it and it permanently puts your threads number on your instagram for everyone to see. You cannot  hide the threads number even after it‚Äôs deactivated even though it says you can remove it, you can‚Äôt. I just wanted to see what it was about and now unless I delete my instagram account and create a new one I am stuck with the threads on there too. In my opinion this is a violation of privacy as anyone can message you. They need to fix this. I would NOT recommend.

title: Probably not the right audience
text: Clearly the app‚Äôs audience is not focused on writing, as on art, design and photography as means of expression. It should be added that by its very technological structure, the priority of the conversations or threads is given to influencers, in some cases ‚Äúhot babes‚Äù of which you usually can't say anything other than "hot" "love you" "you are amazing" or something like that (or at least the normal people). Some media (magazines, newspapers) may offer more topics of conversation, but it is still not clear what people who are not as focused on writing as they are on visuals might have to say about it.

title: Less toxic and more interesting social media, with regular feature updates
text: I like that this is a place where you can discuss your interests with less animosity than on other platforms, and it feels like there‚Äôs regular improvements to the app. It has a huge start and then fell off but now still has a solid enough crowd to keep things interesting.

title: Where do I begin?
text:
This is the 3rd time trying to post this and it somehow is removed.

No matter what or who you follow, only things that show up on your feed are Democrats (I am republican) , 1/2 naked woman, and memes. 

My biggest problem is that if you post something (that is not about the above topics) it goes unseen, but you see a "reply" on your post and can't read it, because the person who commented has a private account. Like why can't you see what someone posted on YOUR post? 

You can't get verified unless your famous or pay, which is dumb. 

Again, what's the point is posting if you cannot interact with other people? Why is it that nothing of my interests show up on the feed? But everything I disagree with or don't like nor have interest in? 

This whole thing makes me want to delete this app and IG. 

IG was way better years ago, now it's "pay to play" this app is no different.

I am mad I even entertained this, tragic.

title: Social media without the rails
text: Open social media platform with little protection from stalking behavior. Anyone you friend can be notified of your activities at all times on the app, and you will not be notified as to who has notification on you on. When linked to your IG it makes it really easy for scammers and malicious parties to track your activities in multiple ways.

title: It can be better than twitter
text: I really wish the feed would allow for me to see all posts from the ones I follow only instead of just seemingly random users‚Ä¶ this should be an absolute priority or I feel this app is going to loose users fast. It‚Äôs not needed for me to see all random people in my feed‚Ä¶ match what u have on insta already and this would be the bomb. Also I should be able to see what‚Äôs trending‚Ä¶ in a way. Just to know in general what‚Äôs going on on the platform!!!!

title: So much SPAM
text:
Give us the option, or just eliminate it completely, to turn OFF seeing posts on our feed that aren‚Äôt from who we follow or shared from them.  These ‚Äúsuggested posts‚Äù take over the feed and you can‚Äôt see what/who you want to see.  I finally found the setting on IG to pause this for 30 days and I saw so many posts I missed for who I actually follow.   

Make it a setting; make it like IG, or heck make it like Twitter where there‚Äôs a tab to see just who you follow. 

As it is now, I don‚Äôt think this app is for me with all the garbage forced into my feed

title: unusable right now
text: PLEASE make posts searchable instead of just accounts, either through hashtags or by searching for words that appear in the postsüò≠ also needs the ability to pin posts. its barely usable in its current state since i want to search for certain topics and be able to find people i dont already know. this feels like a total fumble since i could totally see myself using it as a substitute for twitter IF AND ONLY IF search functions were actually useful.

title: Threads-porn
text: Threads has got some real bad problems with porn! Everyone seems to be turning it in and begging thread, zuck, mosseri and meta to fix it, to no avail! I myself sent them what we are getting! It was taken down because of guidelines. How sweet we all may see it but when you are showed it goes against guidelines? Please fix this issue! Before more people bell out on this social media platform! Fix the porn. Hidden words don‚Äôt even seem to be helping! The company should be fixing this pronto!

title: Better and better
text: The app itself continues to improve, bit by bit, week by week. But more importantly, the platform has now reached critical mass with both the quality and the quantity of engaged users that it feels like a community. A place you want to engage with frequently and constructively. I‚Äôm no Meta fan (nor its peers)  but I applaud them for how they‚Äôve approach the development of Threads.

title: Censorship, Race, & Money
text:
It's simple, and it's in the title. This app was made to compete against another media platform to both gain money and members, and to boost censorship.
Nobody is having fun here except for both the Instagram employees, and company profiles.
This app is one of the worst ever created and a big example of what a media company would do for money, even though/if they already seem to have "enough".

title: a good foundation!
text:
as of right now, threads has a good foundation and has the ability to grow and expand! obviously there‚Äôs room for improvement and many key features that people want are missing, it‚Äôs clear that future updates will come through and hopefully make threads a great, polished social media app. 

personally, i‚Äôd love to see the inclusion of a ‚Äòpeople you follow‚Äô timeline, bookmarks, the ability to see quotes on a thread, messaging and group chats, and more personalization on profiles such as location and a header. i think that with those additions (and others of course), people will begin to prefer what threads will have to offer and make the switch!

thank you for making this app and i can‚Äôt wait to see where it goes in the future! :)

title: Crashes when I try to reply/post
text: I got to enjoy the app for maybe 2 hours before it decided that it was going to crash whenever I try to reply to a thread or post my own. I can However still follow people and like post no problem. I can also respond to follow requests. But I can't use the app to share my own content which is the whole reason I downloaded it. I have seen some reviews about it doing the same thing for anyone with an Iphone 8 or lower and guess what? I have an aiphone 8. Please fix this I want to enjoy the app fully.

title: Way to go IG and Threads team! üëè
text:
Except not at all. 

You screwed the pooch when you put everyone‚Äôs thread‚Äôs badge number to appear as 100M+ the other day. Not realizing it to be an apparent glitch, I removed my Threads badge from my IG. 

I was around #790,000 and thought that was cool to be within the first million. So I hid the badge not thinking twice about reading the notification regarding not being able to reinstate it because‚Ä¶well that would be stupid to not have that function as one of the most used app ecosystems around. 

Now I don‚Äôt have it and, while my own fault and it‚Äôs a stupid clout chasing part of social, this is one of the dumbest implementations of product features, or lack there of, in recent memory. It was legitimately the only reason I kept the app. Y‚Äôall better find a way to provide a reinstatement or I may kms. Do you want the blood of a poor, mid-20s gay on your hands? Maybe Zuck does, but surely not all of you do.

title: Trending Needed
text: I think the thing that formerly put twitter at the top was the trending topics, as it really showcased what people were talking about on a large scale and was a great way to stay up to date on current events and news. Without it I don‚Äôt think threads provides enough to add value to an over saturated social app space‚Ä¶ also, make threads work with Instagram! Image posts should be able to share to both places simultaneously and interconnect much more. Don‚Äôt fumble this opportunity to topple the Muskrat.

title: Zuckerberg lied to get us over
text: Biggest reason for my one star review was the lie that we kept our followers. I signed up and begin to chat only to realize my followers were being added one by one. We still need to build this platform. Second I can‚Äôt deactivate my account. Now I can‚Äôt remove the threads badge from my Instagram profile. When I remove the badge it says ‚Äúonce you remove you can‚Äôt add again‚Äù I hit remove and refresh and it‚Äôs added again. Making people use or promote your platform, when they‚Äôve decided they don‚Äôt want to use it, against their will, is not a good idea.

title: Dope
text: Great app, great execution and anybody saying otherwise is just hating or a twitter agent. They do need to fix the follower issue though because I‚Äôm not able to see who individually followed me unless I‚Äôm on a private account and therefore I can‚Äôt follow anyone back without going through all my followers and searching for specific people. Notifications should work just like how instagram does

title: Huge privacy violation
text:
Check the app privacy section! This app harvests massive amounts of your personal data, including your exact home address, what you buy, where you go, who is in your contacts list, and even your personal HEALTH information. No matter what ‚ÄúMeta‚Äù promises, they WILL exploit this information to make money. 

There are safer non-profit social networking options out there, such as Mastodon, that don‚Äôt take your personal data and sell it to other companies (and governments!). 

Bravo to Apple for requiring app developers to disclose how much of our personal data these ‚Äúfree‚Äù apps are trying to collect!

title: Useless
text: Apparently, I have no choice in what shows up on my ‚Äúhome‚Äù page/feed. I logged in once for the first time and saw posts by people I know/followed on instagram. That was cool. I closed the app. A few minutes later, I opened the app, and posts by people I know/follow are no where to be seen, including the ones I had seen briefly before. Instead, my entire ‚Äúhome‚Äù page is nothing but posts by accounts I don‚Äôt know OR follow OR want to see. I can‚Äôt get back to or find ones I might care about no matter how much I might scroll. If this is the way this app works, I will just delete it.

title: Horrible App
text: App worked for a week. For months, I have not been able to post, reply, read replies, or look at anything except the main page. I keep getting the message, content not available, or something went wrong, try again. I have uninstalled, reinstalled. Logged out, signed back in. Even uninstalled, and reinstalled Instagram several times. I am running a compatible phone with the most recent IOS. No method works. I have submitted numerous problem tickets. No one ever gets back to me, nor fixes the problem. I am in the U.S. so it‚Äôs not a region issue. Frustrating.

title: Please make it better
text: Okay. I love the peace that Threads brings. But I hope y‚Äôall are working on bringing more features to this thing. Such as the ability to search key words or subjects, a main page with today‚Äôs highlights, subject/topic segregation (news, sports, weather, entertainment, food, etc), and the like. Having to scroll and scroll and scroll to find something interesting is extremely tedious. I‚Äôm not going back to Twitter. That crazy man ruined it. So make this better, PLEASE!

title: About the ‚Äútimeline‚Äù
text: There is a threading issue that is preventing me from using it instead of Twitter and I hope you can fix it. It is about the "timeline" and it is that I hope to be able to read from the last post that I read when I close the application so as not to miss anything that has been published since the last time I read it until I open it again, that is, to be able to read from where I stopped reading.

title: Wow 5/5 wouldn‚Äôt change a thing
text:
I have never seen a social media platform, bring together so many different strangers and promote such good positivity like threads! 
 Threads is a social media platform that lets people express their feelings, thoughts, or ideas at any given second knowing that you‚Äôre not by yourself and have someone to talk to.
This app has so much potential!

title: Fix the mess
text: I am based on Cuba and the app was working properly few weeks but a week a go I just can see the content that is posted by the people but on my profile or notification section show me ERROR and remains empty. I also can‚Äôt post anything! I have asked some friend about it and it is the same for them. Please, fix it!

title: Poorly positioned, this app seems arbitrary
text:
So I haven‚Äôt all of the Meta (‚Äúmost effective‚ÄΩ‚Äù) apps, and none of them clearly identify how they‚Äôre different from the others. Now, in addition to apps with posts / comments, Threads launches‚Ä¶and it hasn‚Äôt informed me what job it was implemented  to do.
I was fine eith Facebook alone. Now Instagram 
, an unpolished offering that‚Äôs fullof fake people and spammers. 

 Nope. Not checking this out until you provide users with a way to recover hijacked facebook profiles. You take no responsibility for your data mining operation, and y‚Äôall shady.

title: im obsessed ü§©
text:
I like this app!
ever since I was was introduced to this app, I was confused because I thought the old version of it came back üò≠ but now I like this version of threads. now I can finally get some attention from the memes I post on this app. whenever I wake up in the morning, this was the first app that I open (which was crazy). anyways I really really like this app üòÅ

title: Surprise surprise
text: If you‚Äôre like me, you‚Äôre absolutely sick of hearing about politics these days. Every single post suggested to me was an obvious attempt to push a certain political agenda! I spent the first 10 minutes basically blocking every account with a blue check mark beside it because it was the same ole stuff over and over again, and all of it was political. I deleted Twitter for the same reason; I mean, Geez! Why can‚Äôt we just let people have their own beliefs, ideas, and opinions, and be respectful of that? I would love a social media platform that doesn‚Äôt allow political posts for once!

title: Twitter knock off that is suppressed
text: Anything that has Zuckerberg‚Äòs name attached to it, you gotta be careful about. I don‚Äôt think Zuckerberg is a bad guy. I think he‚Äôs a good dude actually. But, he doesn‚Äôt make the final decisions about what Meta does. A lot of people think he does. He‚Äôs just a puppet at this point basically. This app was designed to suppress and conceal the truth. To let the left continue their hidden agendas. And I‚Äôm not saying this as a Republican or anything. I‚Äôm not. I used to be 100% Democrat years ago. I‚Äôm more middle of the road now. But I like the truth, and I like being uncensored. You don‚Äôt get either of those on this app.

title: Get it together
text: I decided to give Threads a go, but wanted it to serve a specific purpose vs Instagram and the other social platforms I use. After I ported over all the accounts I was following to start, I went in and unfollowed A LOT of them (went from ~250 to 50). My ‚Äúfollowing‚Äù list reflects this. Yet I still see all of the same original accounts in my feed, as well as others I was never following in the first place on Instagram (and no, the latter aren‚Äôt even showing up because someone I follow replied on their thread). Clearly a significant bug(s) here leading to an awful user experience.

title: Beats other apps by a long shot
text: As other short-form thread based platforms sink like the titanic, Threads rises from their ashes. There is as of yet no paywall, no verification to boost yourself to the top, no post-viewing limit, and most importantly the platform has a zero tolerance policy for hate speech. The community is cool as a cucumber, the front page isn't flooded with hate and anger like it is on other sites. TL;DR: its well worth switching over.

title: Loving Threads
text: I love the fact that you can add links with your post and I feel more engaged more personable then on Instagram. I hate how political Twitter has become. I hope that Threads does not do the same thing. You can change the prompt to just see the people that you are following but I actually want to meet new people so I am leaving it as it is for sure.
